comment: Professor Holden is the best! Unfortunately, she will not be returning next school year, but I still wanted to express how great of a professor she is. She really takes the time to explain every concept and will work with students who may be struggling. Kennesaw is definitely losing a great professor. I'm glad I got the opportunity to have her.

If you pay attention in class, there is no way you can fail this class. She gives ALOT of extra points on tests and quizzes. And she drops the lowest test grade. She also posts her powerpoints online.

Although Holden is very sarcastic  shes actually quite funny. Don't worry if you've taken stats before. She explains every thing very well. There are quizzes and homework but they are online and you get multiple attempts at the homework. She offers 70 points extra credit if you come to class. The test are easy and are laced with bonus points.
A little cray. But makes class interesting, will always help you understand the problems.

Took this class my freshman year with a different professor & got a D; took this class this summer & got an A+. She's great! She gives bonus points for almost every assignment & she's extremely fair. Attendance isn't necessarily mandatory, but it is a big chunk of your grade so I would go.

One of the best math professors i have ever had. She gives bonus points on almost every assignment so there is no reason to fail the class. If you pay attention in class and take notes you will do well on the tests. Attendance is mandatory but it's an easy 70 extra points to earn for the end of the class. You pretty much won't use the textbook.
Ms. Holden is absolutely fantastic. I am seriously bad at Math, but she gives you every opportunity she can for extra credit and is a very fair, clear professor. Take her if you are scared of math.

This class is an easy A. While she can be a little scattered, she gives tons of bonus. Basically if you fail her class its your own fault. She is very reasonable. Drops your lowest test grade. If you have an A she does not make you take the final. She takes attendance and gives points so go to class. The book is helpful, I used mine a lot. Take her

She is such a nice teacher, always wants to help and make sure you understand. She knows that most people just take this as a core. Drop lowest test grade or don't take final if you have all As on tests. Powerpoints all online. Attendance points.

Love this lady :) Shes so sweet! I literally am horrible at math but everything is doable.90 points of your grade is based on attendance! so show up and pay attention and you're set! I pulled out an a and let me just say I made a c in college algebra . She makes her quizzes and homework possible to make over 100 on those. TAKE HER. You wont regret
She is precious, and this class is cake!

I suck a math like literally I am lucky if I pull out a C, but she makes this class easy. The homework is easy, the test are the easiest math test I've ever taken. I walked out of this class with a high 90. I know a group of people who got ABOVE a 100 in her class. She is nice, helpful and makes math not so dreadful.

ABSOLUTELY LOVED HER! If people are saying anything bad, they obviously aren't ready for college. She is such an amazing teacher! I took this class in the summer and & it was the best decision. I am so bad with math and I made it out with a high A! Definitely take her if you get the chance! So much extra credit, wants everyone to do well!

If you are not good at math then you do not want to take this class. She is a bit in the clouds and  goes off on random topics most of the class and she is DEF one of those teachers who just shows you how "they" know how to do the work. I had to drop the class because her instructions were very unclear and just all over the place. Hope this helps.

Professor Holden gives you every opportunity to make an A, if you don't it is because of your own personal negligence.  Tons of extra credit and she practically hand feeds you the test questions in the review.  Book is not required
All of her powerpoints are online and does most homework online. She gets confused and has to re-explain things often. The tests are pretty easy. It's easy to get an A as well.

Without a doubt, one of the best teachers I have EVER had. She gives opportunities for bonus points on every exam and quiz, some homework bonus too. The only way you can fail this course is by not doing your work. She makes statistics easy to understand, keeps it basic. She will help anyone who asks for it. If you need an A for your GPA, take her!

She is very nice and very funny, in a quirky kind of way. She is HUGE on extra credit, and you would have to be borderline stupid to not get an A or B in her class. Just read the book outside of class a little, because sometimes in class it can be hard to follow.I have an A+ right now, and the final is not required.Take her, it will boost your GPA!
She is very nice and always gives extra credit. You dont need to buy the book for her class. Easy to get an A in her class.

She gets very confused very easily. Her lecture are very boarding. If you study an  do well on test and quizzes you will have either a or b in class.  Most of quizzes are take home . On every test some of review problem are on test plus extra credit,

She gets a little confused sometimes while explaining things, but it was actually a fairly easy class for me. You will get an A as long as you keep up with the homework and actually study for the tests. Every quiz was take home and she gives at least 15 bonus points on every quiz. A lot of the test questions came straight from the reviews.

Professor explains problems when asked.  Sometimes the material is more than I wanted to know, but at least she isn't monotone.  Tests are hard. Glad she posts the notes online, cause I can't write all that information down as fast as it's given.

She makes things harder than they need to be.  She'll skip from chapter 2, to chapter 9, and expect you to know how to do chapter 3 through 8.  Will use Powerpoint because she can't answer questions without it.  Constantly answers questions incorrectly.  Seems as if she doesn't know the material and therefore is unable to answer questions you have.
